website_summaries.verdict: Wyze's Cam Pan is a remarkably full-featured security camera, especially considering its low price.
pros: The Wyze Cam Pan indoor security camera costs just $30 and includes free 14-day cloud storage and optional local storage
It also works with Alexa and IFTTT, has motion detection zones, can listen for smoke and CO alarms, and can send you custom alerts
cons: It doesn't work with Google Assistant or have a web app
The mobile app works fine, but could use a design refresh

customer_reviews.title: You can view anywhere from your phone. No temperature detection
customer_reviews.text: After going through multiple nursery cams, I am SUPER impressed with this camera (especially for the money)! No app issues, great video quality, simple easy setup. Hands down better than the other video monitors we’ve had.
customer_reviews.author: Stori

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend as a security camera.(edit: I wouldn't recommend for anything)
customer_reviews.text: Good for watching pets while you're away, but I would not / do not trust this camera for security purposes. Playback videos skip 2 to 4 seconds at a time and the motion alerts aren't reliable to pick up motion. I know of several instances where it has missed movement. The point of a security cam is so that you don't miss anything. Customer service has not gotten back with me after contacting them twice. I would return it if I still had the box. Regardless, I'm on the market for something a bit more expensive, but more efficient. Edited to add: shortly after posting this review, it stopped working all together and customer support is unhelpful.
customer_reviews.author: mae

customer_reviews.title: Won’t connect
customer_reviews.text: As of 9/6/2018 Like many others won’t connect :(. Setup was a breeze connected fine during that process. Kept device in same location as setup but just won’t ever connect. Spend more time trying to connect than actual viewing of live feed. Also I have WiFi devices working from every room of house, so seems specific to just this device. Unfortunately in my case didn’t live up to the hype. Will be retiurming this product.
customer_reviews.author: James Morales

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!! little wifi security cam
customer_reviews.text: FANTASTIC!! little wifi security cam. Loaded with features. I have this perched on my mantle above fireplace. Crystal clear 1080p image. two way talking with my family on the way from work. Great to keep an eye on the dog. What a deal for around $30.00 and change. Don't waste your money on a Canary or any other expensive cam. This on is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: ToddB

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Took delivery of this and set it up. Have several of the Wyze V2 cameras already, and setup is so easy. Camera worked but the lens was stuck in the upright position. The controls via the phone would not correct it. I tried customer support before returning. Nope, nada, nothing. No response whatsoever. Disappointed to say the least. Just got a return label. When they work they are great. If they don't, and you need support, you may be SOL. YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: Sepen

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: Push notifications do not work even though all the settings are correct. Have had it for three days and it has only caught and saved motion video four times, and has only sent a notification to my phone once, randomly. Works okay if you are using it as a monitor, but not good as a security/alert camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Beware only 12 seconds of motion recorded with a 5 minute cool down before the next recording!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these and after a week I unplugged them because of the uselessness of them. Buyers should beware that only 12 seconds of motion detected will be recorded for play back... that is it! And then there is a 5 minute delay before the next motion is recorded for 12 seconds. If you want to review the rest of what has been recorded they advise you to input a micro sd card to continuously record to which requires you to manually review all of the footage to review those times that movement was recorded. I have now gone back to mounting my old iPhones with the Manything app and reviewing motion detection through them instead.
customer_reviews.author: Starlord

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Way To Keep An Eye On Things
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a little hiccup-y. There was a little more to it than just plug 'n play but, in the end, this is worth it. There's definitely a place for these cameras, and they're probably destined to be sitting in every garage, coffee shop, living room, and pool room in America. At this price, why stop at one, and why not gift one to everyone in the family on every occasion? Pictures are clear, alerts are ok once they're up and running, and the camera's habit of obviously following people around may be a little unnerving, but is probably a great theft deterrent.
customer_reviews.author: LoveThatRonWhite

customer_reviews.title: Unrealiable Wyze Cam Pan; buy the Wyze Cam instead.
customer_reviews.text: After a week of use, encountered connection error code 0 each time I tried to use my purchased Wyze Cam Pan or the replacement Wyze Cam Pan (provided by Amazon Tech Support). Worked with Wyze Tech Support team to review my camera's connectivity to my router using the "RouteThis Helps" application scan. Per their review, my signal looks incredibly clear and they could not determine why either camera was having trouble on my network. Returned products. On the other hand, my other two Wyze Cam (v2) continue to work great.
customer_reviews.author: SARAHHHHHH

customer_reviews.title: Just 1/2 ok
customer_reviews.text: It works, but bigger than expected (yes, price is v.reasonable) and the device makes a plastic-scraping noise as it moves around. Not too bad of a product, for sampling, at this under$40 price. But the noise is too noticable for ordinary use in a home.
customer_reviews.author: T-Rex "Gas"osaurus

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare to set up, initially and after firmware upgrades.
customer_reviews.text: Camera is fine for the price, features work, but don't EVER try to upgrade firmware unless you have an hour to attempt to re-setup the camera as new. Connecting issues, random error codes, re-setup failures... It is an absolute nightmare to get the camera working again every time the firmware wants to update itself. I guess you ultimately get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Hotbod Handsomeface

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I love it for the price and its capabilities; better than my arlo so far and much cheaper. I would spend another 10 dollars and it would still be worth it if the motor was quieter. Great product; bought another one. you cant really hide it as the motor sound will give away its location.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sends data to servers in China
customer_reviews.text: Had this set up in my office, but my IT department noticed suspicious activity with data packets constantly going to a server in China. A google search found a number of similar concerns on Reddit. Loved the camera, but the ongoing activity and the low price make me wonder.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R.

customer_reviews.title: Good Price, Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. And you can't beat the price. The picture quality is excellent. I also have an Arlo Cam Q, and the picture quality is inferior on the Arlo. My only complaint is the app is a bit confusing to operate, as the different options for the camera are not clearly explained. I also love that you can put your own micro SD card in it, and do continuous or motion/sound activated recording locally. Very few cameras have that, as they want you to pay for their cloud service.
customer_reviews.author: RUSSELL

customer_reviews.title: 0 support
customer_reviews.text: Everything normal hooks up to my Xfinity router. Not this, first one didn't, ordered 2nd, nope. Emailed company, nope. Spent hours of my life researching to make it work, nope. Two of them going back, yep. Good theory, really wanted it to work. Bad business model, chinese hardware stolen from legit company with poorly managed app= no worky
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Two cameras didn’t work at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these units after reading the reviews. They arrived and I followed the steps for installation which are simple and it didn’t work. I emailed customer service and 4days later they still haven’t contacted me back. Now I know why they are so cheap, it’s a volume product but not quality oriented. If you are one of the lucky that buys this product and it works then great. But if it doesn’t work or breaks somehow, good luck with getting support to fix the issue. Just glad mine didn’t work out of the box rather than dealing with no customer support in the future. I’d rather pay more and have a quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Omar K

customer_reviews.title: A white plastic brick after 10 days
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what exactly happened, but I saw the camera had turned facing the wall and I checked the app which said it was offline. The light on the front was solid yellow but otherwise, it was dead. Tried power cycle, factory reset, different power adapter and different cable. Nothing changed. Nonresponsive, just that yellow, non-blinking cyclops staring back at me mockingly. Browsed the website for troubleshooting steps to no avail. Much of the support information is for the app or other products. It was a decent product while it worked, but I expected more than ten days. I didn't even get a chance to put it in its final location after a getting acquainted period.
customer_reviews.author: J Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Audio is very bad
customer_reviews.text: The audio on this camera is terrible. The picture quality is fantastic and the app is easy to use and straightforward. I want to love this camera, but the sound is useless - any words are incomprehensible. I initially contacted Wyze and they sent me a replacement camera, but the sound was equally bad. The sound is loud and garbled, like it is coming through a speaker at a stadium, it gets randomly louder and quieter, and occasionally echoes. I am returning the camera.
customer_reviews.author: veggiefleur

customer_reviews.title: only get about 1 of every 10 motion alarms
customer_reviews.text: The camera works ok. I got two of these. Picture quality is good. Easy to setup on iPhone. Unfortunately I only get about 1 of every 10 motion alarms.
customer_reviews.author: TechGeek

customer_reviews.title: Hackers get into this camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera gets hacked.. i heard giggles of children in my house and noticed it was coming from The camera.. someone was watching me and my child for over a month!! Disconnected forever!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jury is still out on this.  It is just a gadget do not mistake for security.
customer_reviews.text: Wyze makes mention over and over, do not use this for security. But, thats what I wanted to keep eye on for the sump pump. However, its always iffy. More for keeping eyes on pets, etc. I wouldnt trust it watching my house. We have a big brand for that anyway, but thought these would be good for other minor things and thats what we will use these for. The company is very good though. I give customer service 5 stars. There are many blogs on their site for questions, utube, etc. They clearly state to not use for household protection, so no fault of theirs.
customer_reviews.author: readanlearn

customer_reviews.title: RTSP firmware would not install
customer_reviews.text: I was glad to see Wyze finally released an RTSP firmware for their cameras, this allows it to work with 3rd party server software like Blue Iris and not be dependant on yet another cloud service. Unfortunately the firmware is poorly supported and refused to install, just failed over and over and over. A little searching revealed that if the RTSP firmware is installed, you lose all pan/tilt functions anyway, so it was a total bust even if it had worked. I did not evaluate it in its standard cloud camera out of the box firmware, but by all accounts it's excellent if that works for you.
customer_reviews.author: tj2k

customer_reviews.title: Crashes muchly
customer_reviews.text: The kids and I are on vacation. They were talking about missing the dog back home. I was so excited to bust out the live Wyze feed, and handed my phone to the kids. Unfortunately, the cam had frozen, so there was no feed. A message displayed that maybe if we cycled the power for the camera, it would be able to connect. Huh. The viseo quality is good. Just dont expect to connect to the camera if you are out of the house!
customer_reviews.author: S. Schiraga

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable recording events
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is decent, not great. The huge issue i have with this camera is the customer support. The camera has stopped recording "events" (capturing motion) and I have contacted support several times with no response. It's worth mentioning that I pay for a monthly service with the company for a "full motion capture". I went online and countless people have had this same issue. It is unreliable and I wouldn't recommend to anyone. I have already purchased a different camera and using this as a baby monitor. Dont buy this if you care about it recording events/motion.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: BETTER PICTURE THAN MY NEST CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera, it has a better picture than my nest camera and it can move around unlike my nest camera, for way less than the nest camera. I use it to check on my dog when I'm away and it focuses in on her with great pic quality, the nest cam is always blurry when I zoom in Wyze needs to make a outdoor camera .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy them of you want dependability
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Video feed constantly an issue record feature randomly drops and has huge gaps in the recordings (you would think this would be a top priority to make sure it functioned 100%...it is a camera..) Random messages about not having an sd card.....which is wrong of course. Camera motion is choppy when moving via the app. Both cameras (bought 2 because of the reviews) have these issue. Units worked fine for first few months (convenient) now have become completely unreliable. Not built for longevity apparently. Very disappointing pwrformance based in the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Person detection no longer an option--great for checking in on your pup...
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of the cameras when they had the "person" detection. Now I just use it indoors for watching my pup as he sleeps when I need to run errands and find him myself. The only security and motion I get now on outside cameras is the wind in the bushes and a few ducks and squirrels. Unfortunately I cannot return this or the three cameras including the longer cords purchased. This is no longer a "security camera" option unless you hear someone outside and know the time to look at the footage that is 24/7. Price should have dropped as a result of this change along with removing of quite a few reviews.
customer_reviews.author: JillinWPB

customer_reviews.title: Why do they need to access all my files, photos, etc? Before I can install software
customer_reviews.text: I really, really wanted to like this product. But I can't even open the software unless I surrender all my privacy to them first. They require access to all my files, photos, etc before I can finish installing my software. Why? The only reason I can think of is that they want to spam me and all my friends with sales pitches. Or worse, they're just plain spying on me. Sad really. They could have had a sale from me, and most of my friend if it wasn't for that. Just sad.
customer_reviews.author: A. Aleman

customer_reviews.title: Wyze Cam Pan won't live stream if it cannot contact servers in China
customer_reviews.text: The Wyze Cam Pan won't stream live if the Wyze app cannot contact servers in China. I run an enterprise-grade firewall at my home, and the Wyze app will not live stream unless my China geoblock is removed. This is not a temporary communication as Wyze as claimed online. China servers include 47.112.127.239 and 44.233.123.97. Security risk. Not happy I wasted the money. Buy Ring or Arlo. Update: Wyze posted a response offering to help. There's nothing they can do to help other than program their security cameras to NOT send data to China. The offer of help is useless AND disingenuous.
customer_reviews.author: oaktree

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes it Takes Too Long to Connect
customer_reviews.text: I've got 5 Arlo Pro2 cams. 1 Reolink 1 YesKamo and now this. This is the worst of the bunch in terms of connections. It's sitting maybe 4 feet from my router - and two wifi repeaters within 50 feet. I've tried moving it around. Same problems: "Connecting camera by secure channel".... Sure it is. Every once in awhile I can get it to connect, but oftentimes it takes 2 or 3 tries. UPDATE: Wyze just updated the firmware - and the connection time seemed better. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: pbleier

customer_reviews.title: False motion detection
customer_reviews.text: So I have a couple of the little cubes that I have been impressed with them so I though I would give the pan/tilt a try. The only thing wrong with this cam is that every time it pans it thinks everything is in motion so it records and sends notifications. This is rather irritating and going to pose a problem monitoring the home while away for extended periods of time. I've tried different rooms and settings and still the same results. I gave it at least 2 stars because it has the other good qualities.
customer_reviews.author: Collins

customer_reviews.title: Avoid due to poor microphone and missing features
customer_reviews.text: Almost immediately returned this. The microphone on the product is beyond unusable. When reviewing recordings there's a constant overtone of static and drop outs every few seconds. Research online shows this to be a very regular complaint over the past few years with no resolution in sight. It's apparently a software thing. Night vision is great, field of view is great, as is the motion detection, except... turns out the AI software that detects if it's a human versus your cat...well that contract ended abruptly back in January so now you only get motion detection. Fix the microphone issues and sure, this'll be a worthwhile buy. Otherwise, right now, it's more of a cheap gimmick.
customer_reviews.author: Distantsoil

customer_reviews.title: Functions great but a little noisy when turning
customer_reviews.text: Using this a couple weeks, the video and audio looks great. Love the fact that it follows motion and pan and scan. Only gripe is that it is noisy. Everytime it moves, I can hear it from my bedroom with the bedroom open and it is in the living room. The noise isn't unbearable but when the house is quiet, you can definitely hear it. It almost sounds like a "beep"noise as well when it turns besides the mechanical movement
customer_reviews.author: MISTER&MRSTWOTURBO

customer_reviews.title: Wyze Cams are Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I have four of Wyze cams. Three Pan Cams. One inside and two outdoors with protective covers. I love them. The only drawback is the night vision. Just not up to other cameras, but for the price you can't really go wrong. I also have a Ring doorbell, two Amazon cloud cams and a Blink. Daytime Video quality is great on all cams. Night vision is great on the cloud cams and the ring, but substandard on the Wyze cams. But again the Cloud Cams are 119.00 and the Wyze Cams are 25-40 dollars. I think the Wyze Cams are great depending on the application.
customer_reviews.author: G. Patten

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware : Newest firmware + MicroSD = Problems
customer_reviews.text: As above. Newest firmware + MicroSD resulted in constant reboots, loud buzzing issues, etc. Spent a number of hours with their helpful tech in an attempt to manually downgrade firmware; without success. SD slot wasn't reading SD card. Received a replacement unit and similar constant reboots (no buzzing now) happened with MicroSD card inserted. Have not tried manually downgrading firmware (again) yet. I believe No MicroSD means no local storage which means can't record footage locally. So as a PSA - buyer beware. Their tech is very helpful, to their credit and replacement unit was sent quickly. That said, shouldn't be this painful to get their camera working. Get their non Pan Cam instead, that works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned when we needed it!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So I’m an electrician/electrical engineer I install these cameras all the time. I won’t ever recommend one again I pulled into my driveway and the SD card wasn’t recognized when I installed it it was operating properly. After a few days a crime occurs I actually need it and it’s not recognizing the SD card. The company will say is the SD cards fault it’s a Wyze SD card I injected it put in another one it doesn’t recognize it. So I put in a third brand new SD cardThe reason these cameras are so cheap is because they’re that cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: These cameras are great So easy to install. I bought 2. One for inside and one for out. Mounted the one outside right under my porch so it catches anyone on the porch and also driving up. Inside mounted beside my TV. My home is very open it covers family room kitchen and dining room including front and back door. When you load the app and view the camera you can move the camera around to view a wider range. I would recommend. Great picture , color is good. These were better and cheaper than other camera's I have had. They have been up for about a year and still working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia F

customer_reviews.title: pretty sure someone is watching
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera but I am starting to believe that someone is watching me through the camera. I normally only have it on in the evenings and when I am not at home due to this, but I have noticed that the camera goes to the a different position without me changing it. I do not know if this something that happen with updates or if someone is moving the camera. The audio is pretty good. If this continues to happen I am going to get rid of the camera get a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Sascha G.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Service System
customer_reviews.text: The cameras in general are good BUT, if you are hoping to use these when "on the road" and using cellular data then think again! I have 4 of these and previously worked fine up until a few months ago and now they no longer connect on cell data meaning you have to be permanently connected to WiFi in order to view them. Many checks done online and many people having the same issue. Joined the Wyze page forum to discuss with other users and tech guys and still noone cam solve this issue for many frustrated users. In summary, time to buy different brand of cameras and throw the Wyze ones in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Paolo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for people who like quality and features
customer_reviews.text: I bought a camera that was $7 less in cost with the same primary features but the previous ones picture quality, installation process, app and esthetic was terrible in comparison. I was ready to yet again be disappointed and trying to put all the cords and plugs back the way it came which is impossible for most of us. This camera exceeded my expectations x 10. App is great and has excellent features to allow total control including scheduled times for specified activities. It took me an hour to become an expert. This is the camera for us who are used to technology keeping up. I also rarely leave a rating. A+
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Ferrell

customer_reviews.title: It's a keeper.
customer_reviews.text: I chose this one because it is an American company and the cloud service they use is Amazon, not MIPC(I was concerned about security). Also, I love the free cloud service. It took me some head scratching to figure out the 5 minute interval between motion detection recording rule (it records 12 secondes footage with 5 minute interval between motion detection. So if a footage was recorded at 1:00 even it will not upload anything new till after 1:05.) This works for me because I just needed something to alert me when I'm away from home on trips. The footage is very clear and had no issue connecting to my WiFi or the app.
customer_reviews.author: H. Choi

customer_reviews.title: Worked great before firmware upgrade
customer_reviews.text: If you are interested in purchasing this camera wait. Wyze is having a major issue with their not functioning via remote access after firmware upgrade. Don't upgrade your Wyzecam firmware and Wyzecame appears to have no answer to the issue. Google and you will see everyone is having the same problem after firmware upgrade. Before the upgrade the camera worked great I could access from anywhere in Chicago.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Bricked on first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago and then before I could use it,moved house. Finally unpacked it from its original packing to set it up and the first thing it wants to do is a firmware update. Fair-enough - let it do what it wants to do. Never recovered. Performed the manual firmware procedure advised in their trouble-shooting section. No joy. This thing is a waste of plastic junk now. And if you google this rpoblem you will find I am not alone in this issue - many have suffered the same fate with this. Avoid unless you like pretty white boxes that do nothing
customer_reviews.author: Desertsweeper

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for, the old axiom is true.
customer_reviews.text: Died after 3 weeks and I didn't return that week so screwed. Bought July 1st and couldn't return after July 31st. You get what you pay for. That's why other motion tracking cams are much more expensive. I left seller feedback but don't expect a reply or at least a reply that they will refunded, fix, or replace. I would not recommend this to anyone even though when it worked it did a decent job. Will look for another motion takings cam and bite the bullet on price. Also this was not fully ONDIF compliant and worked sporadically with blue Iris 5
customer_reviews.author: Steven Mather

customer_reviews.title: pan won't connect anymore and make screeching sounds.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Dec 2018, now it has been malfunctioning and I put off troubleshooting malfunctions due to you can't talk to anyone, just send messages, so I put it aside until after the holidays. Wrong, now it's out of warranty. I thought I would be a happy user of Wyze products with another pan cam, six v2's, as many micro-sd's, four bulbs and the sensor starter pack. Now I'm second guessing going with this brand, since when something goes down such as power or wifi, it is a real pain to restart everything. And if you are away, you cannot restart remotely,I have spent extra $$ to get after market mounts and different length cables.
customer_reviews.author: rds

customer_reviews.title: Tech Support Awful
customer_reviews.text: This camera was useful while it lasted, which was only a few months. Now, the camera will not connect to WiFi and is not successfully able to perform a factory reset in order to setup the device as new. Customer service/tech support is non existent and hasn’t responded to my support tickets/requests. My camera has been down for almost two full weeks and no one has responded to my request for support. I guess it’s time to get a Ring stick cam instead. It doesn’t matter how well a camera works, if tech support isn’t prompt, it’s not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J Wamsley

customer_reviews.title: No continuous recording
customer_reviews.text: Great camera with great features. Issue is with continuous recording. It will not do it unless you set a event and motion/sound detection. Then it will only record 12 seconds and then wait 5 minutes before it records again. So it is useless for me to use. A lot can happen in 5 minutes, bad idea. I wanted it to continuous record without setting the motion/sound detection. Support was no help as they just sent me pat answers to my questions and concerns. Another issue is when I put the SSD card in a computer for playback it only show 1 minutes clips. So it is very time comsumming to look at the video.
customer_reviews.author: Kfo

customer_reviews.title: Often doesn't detect the people but will alert you to a tree shadow...
customer_reviews.text: revised 2 weeks later: Randomly stopped working with an error, attempted to reset the device multiple type and nothing happens. Returning. Original Review: I have the camera in my front window so that I can see both my car and the front walkway up to the door. It often does not detect the people coming up, and when it does it will send me an alert about 2 mins later. Which defeats the purpose of having it watch for people coming to my door. Additionally it constantly is detecting the wind moving the trees and shadows from the trees.
customer_reviews.author: kdoodle

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Camera
customer_reviews.text: Only records for 12 seconds when motion or a person is detected and you can not adjust the recording time. If someone breaks into your house the simply can take the camera with them and won't have to worry about what was recorded on the memory card. The picture quality is also pretty poor. I would not recommend this camera to anyone because it is clearly not a good security camera. Another thing I dislike is the fact that it is and sticks out like a sore thumb. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Huey

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Iffy customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality as good as you can expect from such a tiny package. Features and price, amazingly wonderful. Customer service is kinda sorta prompt. But, if the question is too difficult, it could take a couple of days longer. Changed my rating to one star. The company sends you unsolicited offers to your email. As if I needed one more of those. They’re working on an outdoor version. No time schedule. Hopefully soon.
customer_reviews.author: JS Lurkin

customer_reviews.title: Product doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: The camera steadily lags when trying to use the app when away from home. It worked great for the first couple of weeks but then little by little it started getting disconnected and lagging during use. I have 1gbps internet so it’s definitely a hardware or software issue with the camera. You definitely get what you pay for. I’d recommend spending the extra hundred and getting one of the better cameras on the market.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harris

customer_reviews.title: No Cloud Storage? No Problem!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing! The main selling point for me was that I didn't need a cloud subscription! It can handle up to a 32gig micro SD card that will store a few days worth of videos. We have ours set to record only motion so we have several days of footage on the SD card. You can view everything stored on the SD card from your phone. It's as if you had a cloud subscription but you just access the video on the SD card even when you aren't home! Great camera. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dallin

customer_reviews.title: COMPLETE GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: I just caught a man trying to crawl into my open window, the window where the cam pan faces. He was standing literally in front of the camera, no notification. I went up to the window and scared him off. I checked the events and there was NO CAPTURE. HE WAS WELL WITHIN THE MOTION DETECTION AREA. the camera didn’t even capture me when I ran outside. I was running all over the detection area and this camera is SLEEPING!
customer_reviews.author: Kuhkies

customer_reviews.title: Can't connect to AT&T router - updated!
customer_reviews.text: I had this product for 6 months and it worked great. I then switched my internet service to AT&T's fiber service and use their router and modem and it won't connect at all. I created a separate 2.4GHZ network for it and nothing. The only way it'll work now is if I setup a hotspot from my phone. For some reason that works but nothing else does. I spoke with customer service and they weren't much help. Now it's a paperweight. Update, got it to work finally after hours of messing around with settings. Not sure how but it's back to being a decent camera for the price again. Back to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Yoder

customer_reviews.title: good value,
customer_reviews.text: CONS: the motion should be less noisy. No 5GHz wifi support. Wish it cam with an additional wall mount. does not send email motion events with attached photo. (it will alert on the app however to the prescribe user account's email address). The camera sharing only allows the access of live stream and not of the local memory storage PROS: Good resolution. Audio is soft but acceptable and usable. Easy to setup on Iphone. Very good range of motion. The motion tracking feature works amazingly well for a low price point product.
customer_reviews.author: Silkychoices

customer_reviews.title: Made loud buzzing then died
customer_reviews.text: It worked great go the first 6 months. Asides from the annoying constant whirring noise it made when it scans the room. Then it started producing a really jarring loud buzz sound. At first I didn’t know where the buzz came from. After a few more intermittent buzzing over the next month I realize it came from the wyze camera. I restarted it hoping it would be reset. Same thing started happening and now doesn’t turn on. What do I do now?
customer_reviews.author: mec

customer_reviews.title: No longer connects to iOS app. Need to find replacements
customer_reviews.text: We bought 5; they worked great until an iOS app update and camera firmware updates about 2-3 months ago. Now the cameras will not connect to view in the app. If they connect, they drop within 20-30 seconds. I now have 5 useless cameras that I need to find replacements for. You get what you pay for... these are inexpensive for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Boatwaco

customer_reviews.title: Don't depend on them for playback.
customer_reviews.text: I've been fighting with all 3 of these I purchased for past several months. Been on support, tried everything they asked, but still continue to have issues with playback. Most of the time it's either "No SD card detected" or "No video available" etc....This is really aggravating when we have a babysitter coming to the house and just recently had an incident with our baby choking, I wasn't able to play back the video as there wasn't any. I about literally threw the piece of junk across the room. Bottom line, if you want a RELIABLE security camera, then look elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Not good for a security camera, picture quality just OK.
customer_reviews.text: The only good thing about this camera is free cloud and watching live. It does not always record even when there is an actual motion. It waits 5 minutes to record the next clip even if there is an on going activities. This is another example of you pay what you get. I am returning this since my main purpose of this purchase is for a security reason.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you are really particular about motion detetctions
customer_reviews.text: I am not really in need of a motion detector but to feel safe I wanted to add some gadget that keeps me alerted. Did not want to spend lot of money on Ring so went with this. Setup was not a issue for me. But alerts are completely hit and miss. It keeps sending me tree movement notifications but have not seen a single notification for any motion that happens on my drive way( it is in the detection zone) even though so many people pass by and my kids plays there every evening. So it is good if you just want a live feed but cannot rely on motion detection. Pay more and get better gadgets
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the easy setup and great quality picture. Within five minutes of receiving the camera, I had it up and running with no problem so I can observe my 3-d printer in action so I can intervene if a problem develops. It is well worth the cost, in fact a great deal. Picture quality is excellent. I am not affiliated with the company in any way, and I paid full price for the item. This is a real and honest review that I was not paid or asked to write.
customer_reviews.author: Big-Z

customer_reviews.title: 360o horizontal, but limited vertical movement
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Wyze Cam v2 for quite a while now. It has been working very well, and constant software updates make it better and better. The Wyze Cam Pan differs by being able to move the camera angle. The only complain I have is that it has very limited vertical range. I wanted to mount the camera on the ceiling, but I cannot see anything on the floor for probably a 5-6 feet radius because the lens cannot move down enough. I am pleasantly surprised though it can "chase" anything that is moving. As in once the camera recognize you walking, it'll automatically move the lens to keep you in the center of the picture. I like this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard C

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This camera is such good value! I bought this camera to keep an eye on my dog while I'm at work. It was easy to set up and download the app. I put a memory card in it and it records constantly. When the card gets full it just goes over the oldest video. I can take pictures, review video and easily send them through text message. It also has 2 way sound although its a little muffled. The picture quality is great, but if you zoom in it does get blurry. The motion tracking can get a little jerky because she moves around so much, but overall a very good buy for the price. Perfect for what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: SM.

customer_reviews.title: Jury still out on this..  so far not good..
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this product.. I really do, but it is VERY noisy. It scares my dog, and annoys me. So far I have not been able to figure out how to train it to follow movement of my dog, which I why I purchased it. It doesn't follow humans entering my home either. Not sure how useful its going to be. Will keep trying but so far.. it is not working as expected. I am definitely open to suggestions. I purchased one for my brother (gift) and he is having similar issues. at this point, I recommend nest cam over Wizen.. but will change my review/opinion if I ever get this one to work.
customer_reviews.author: S. C. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Audio still bad everything else great
customer_reviews.text: Got the size pan cam for my back porch. The motion detection is awesome. Picture quality is awesome. Great camera in all. I have it three stars because the audio really sucks and again it runs your battery down very fast. If you are looking for a great quality camera that gives you great pics this is the one. If you want great audio, this is not the one. Audio does not really matter to me I just need to see what is going on when I am not at home. Unlike my other two wize cams this one did not come with anything to stick it to.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: The mandatory app for it is easy to use and share with other people. The feed is very responsive but does require a constant wi-fi connection to operate. The zoom is a digital zoom and when zoomed in the picture looks a bit grainy. Considering the price for this thing, you get a movable camera with HD, possible recording and snapshots with micro-sd cards, this is a great bargain. Not a good hidden camera. There's a small blue LED that gives away its position and it's about the size of a soda can so people will see it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeriel Minguillan

customer_reviews.title: Motor stopped working after just two months, stopped recognizing SD cards, no customer support
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this camera at first. Two months after I got it, the camera stopped panning, it just says "end of motion" no matter how the camera is oriented. Either the motor is bad or the end switches. I can turn it gently by hand it it moves fine, so I know it's not mechanically blocked. Even worse, the camera stops recognizing the SD card once it's been plugged in for about a day. I've written to Wyze multiple times to try to get a replacement, but they just answer with an automated message with trouble shooting steps a few days later. I write back again and again and receive no response. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Voyager

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but  could be better
customer_reviews.text: For the price its fine to buy... unable to switch off from the app. Not useful for continuous viewing, have to refresh every certain minute which is the reason i have to use more my other cam to have continuous uninterrupted view... hope the manufacture would adress these problem!!!
customer_reviews.author: suman

customer_reviews.title: Their #800 phone number and support does not work
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2. At first it worked. The problems I encounter 1. I get no warning to my phone when motion or sound I have to open it up to check and that's a pain. 2. I set the camera to ONE location it keeps reverting back to facing THE WALL. This is useless. So I have to manually open up my app to look 3. When I set location and want to watch LIVE streaming... It will revert back to the wall I called customer service no answer I went to there site for support no support available I read there how to's and it doesn't work I need a 3 Rd camera...but I recommend you don't buy this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I read about this camera for days. It appeared to be an amazing deal. What I got was an annoying dud. I did the firmware update as part of the setup. I set a detection zone - which was nearly impossible becuase the camera just spins endlessly and without detecting motion. Then the camera just kept spinning and making noise - completely useless. I will be returning to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: edsal

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound otherwise great.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera overall. I like how the iOS app works. I use it to watch my cat while I’m not at home. The motion detection is sometimes slow, the recorded video starts with the cat in the middle of the room and I never know where she’d been hiding. You can record to cloud or to SD card, both works seamlessly well. The only issue is sound. The sound does not sync with picture and it is oh so quiet and has a lot of static. It is pretty much as if it was not there, which is a shame because this makes really nice videos.
customer_reviews.author: Lukas Polok

customer_reviews.title: Replacement WYZE Cam Pan quit after few weeks!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 6 WYZE cams and 2 WYZE Pan cams since January 2019. BAD NEWS: One of Cam Pans quit after 11 months. I contacted WYZE and they replace it. The camera could not see the memory card I inserted from the beginning. I emailed WYZE two weeks ago, no answer...I followed up since the camera quit 4 days ago...no answer again! I checked my other cam pan the other day and that is not reading the memory card any more either!!! soon this one will die too. GOOD NEWS: I highly recommend the original cube looking WYZE Cams since all six are working great and I have never had any issues with them.
customer_reviews.author: MOJTABA S. SHOBEIRI

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, constant issues
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a waste of ti.e. the app and the server for the app constantly goes down. It is always telling me to recycle the power on the camera and its just not reliable. Ive had it not even 2 months now and it worked perfect for about 2 or 3 weeks and since then jts been nothing but problems and for security it can not trusted.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Mangiapane

customer_reviews.title: Survived the Eye of a Hurricane
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this Wyze camera to place outside. Then came hurricane Florence. I was able to monitor my place after we were evacuated. We were in the eye of the storm and when power and internet were restored, the little Wyze cam dutifully popped back up, upside down from the winds, but it was able to pan and I could see the status of my property. After I returned, I found it also took on water and still worked. I am amazed by this product for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Ozark Vegan

customer_reviews.title: Depends on what you want from it.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve included pics of it. My hallway is 50ft long. The zoom is good for about 10ft, after that you have to be 1080p HD mode which uses about 1mb of data and the picture (daytime) is only slightly more clear. I do not believe you be able to make out a face. So if it’s for a standard size 12x12- 15x15 room then yes, get it. If it’s for a hallway over 15ft, don’t. A camera that’ll zoom further than that will cost upwards of $175.
customer_reviews.author: Impulse Buyer

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE! Rotated until wires broke?!?! UNBELIEVABLE
customer_reviews.text: I've wasted enough time on this junk, so this review has to be short because I AM DONE. Camera auto rotated until wire twisted itself free of the circuit board. Motion detection extremely flawed, flase alarms. IR night vision glares off of everything, making it useless. Micro USB power hub is in a great spot for moisture to drip into. LOSES CONNECTION CONSISTENTLY. DO NOT MOUNT YOUR CAMERAS OUT OF REACH, YOU WILL HAVE TO RECONNECT THEM OVER AND OVER. My home network is extremely strong, this is a Wyze Labs issue. I wish I could return all 6 of the cameras, mounts and housings I've purchased. What a massive mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Nic Btw

customer_reviews.title: Returned and purchased Wyze cam v2
customer_reviews.text: I needed indoor coverage and did not want to waste my Arlo outdoor cameras. Sadly the night vision stopped working days after setup whereas my Wyze v2 camera in another location performed flawlessly. So I ended up returning back to Amazon and for me the pan and tilt was not even needed for the coverage area I thought. The night vision is an ongoing issue and Wyze claims you don’t have enough background light for night vision to work right , ok then why does the v2 camera work flawlessly in the same location? This camera is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Good picture quality and good night vision. I'm giving it an overall 4-stars primarily because of the jumpiness of the pan picture and the additional fee for the motion detection. You get two weeks free, but after that you have to pay!
customer_reviews.author: RonRN

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Wyze v2 cameras in my home had them for a while now and i love them. So I decided to buy a Wyze cam pan to add another camera for my drive way. After programming it and installing it and hiding all the wires i notice that right in front of the lens there is a scratch or piece of plastic or something on the inside so now im stuck with a blurry image. But since I already went through the pain of running wire and drilling my wall for the mount i dont want to go through removing everything and sending it back. Guess this was my last Wyze product
customer_reviews.author: Arturo

customer_reviews.title: Person detection only if you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This camera has been ok until now that they want money for the person detection feature , making this camera obsolete. There should be an option to have the camera saving the events to the sd card instead on the cloud since the camera is already paid. This is the reason why I bought the camera in the first place to detect a person not to detect a dog or a tree moving in the middle of the night
customer_reviews.author: Rafa

customer_reviews.title: Great value, not designed for outdoor use.
customer_reviews.text: If you just need a camera to stick inside a window these work great. They're not really designed/rated for outdoor use, and they don't do well with window screens, but for inside use or for setup in a non-screened window they work great. The Wyze app isn't amazing, and there's a small fee of $1 and some change per camera if you want "full motion" detection. Otherwise it records 11 second clips with several minutes cooldown between detections. But Wyze provides 1-week rolling storage, so compared to pretty much every other brand these are great if you have pretty straightforward needs (like catching people stealing your packages).
customer_reviews.author: Charles Coates

customer_reviews.title: Bought Two - Image Quality Is Very Good And Software/Features Excel - One Is Failing Now
customer_reviews.text: I bought two cameras about 2 years ago to build my own security system when replacing a national subscription-based system, and these cameras work great and come with nicely featured software. My only complaint is that one of the cameras started has begun failing with terrible image quality no matter what I do with the configuration or reboots. The other camera, however, is still working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: DigDawg

customer_reviews.title: Not so Wyze failure is simple as black & white.
customer_reviews.text: Where is Wyze quality control when packaging products? Cam Pan arrived w black stains. I did not test the functionality of the cam. It failed at box opening for plastic production quality. This Cam Pan arrived factory sealed and pack with a black dusted stained tint within the plastic housing. I initially thought it was dust that’d simply wipe off. Nope. It’s baked right inside the plastic from the mold injection machine that created it. How does this literal black & white flaw get shipped to consumers? It unfortunately taints everything I originally thought Wyze. Quality control is everything. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoFlyBy

customer_reviews.title: Great picture - terrible software
customer_reviews.text: Like most others who purchased these cameras, I found the camera photo quality to be fine, but the software running them is absolutely TERRIBLE. Plus, like most others, these cameras destroyed brand new high quality memory cards. The range from my router to a camera is extremely limited. twenty-five feet is optimal. Anything over that, and the control of the camera goes to about zero. The recording to their cloud is horrible. I had seven motion-activated clips supposedly recorded to the cloud, but on two were actually viewable; the other five have not "finished uploading". Plus, there's no way to delete these phantom videos! I will NOT buy anymore of these cameras!
customer_reviews.author: Edward F. Newbold

customer_reviews.title: Most amazing camera can’t believe it’s $36 😳
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 will be buying more! I’ve recommended them to at least 4 people who bought them immediately! The video quality is amazing, they captured everything sound movement sends alerts. So many ways to customize them. You can change the sensitivity. I have one set up in my front window and it captures everything in my courtyard front door through the window 😮! The app is awesome works with Alexa all I have to do is say “Alexa show me the front door” and I get a live feed from my front door !
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The price is great, you cant beat the features and when It worked it worked well. The problem with mine is that it constantly did not work. It would always power off. I think part of it was due to a loose cable connecting the USB power cord to the device. That occurred on day 0. It also didnt help that if it scanned the room it would unplug itself. It served the purpose for me though of seeing I I would enjoy or like a camera. I would spend better money on a reliable system like Arlo or Nest
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Easy target for hackers
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved the camera. Extremely affordable and good image quality. Audio was never great, but not a major point for my needs. After a few weeks using with no issues, I came home to find my dog very distraught and agitated. The camera, which I had turned off prior leaving the house, was on and moving it’s motion detection. I heard a strangers voice coming from it. Basically someone hacked into the camera and have been annoying the dog while we were out of the house. Not a trustable software. I have not used again since.
customer_reviews.author: PNeiva

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity and intuitive, very fast implementation
customer_reviews.text: I have just purchased and received two Wyzecam2, and a single Wyzecam Pan. As they are brand new here, I can't provide opinions on night vision, durability, etc....yet. But as far as initially commissioning, updating the firmware, connection to my Google phone, initial appearances and video...I am impressed. Have one temporarily set in a window... running on a Powercore 20000 portable power bank... curious to see how long it lasts... just for temporary placements with out an outlet immediately available. So far, every thing is brilliant! Shall endeavor to check back in in a few weeks, after some more usage and trials.... Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Truly incredible camera! Buying a few more for sure.
customer_reviews.text: This camera really is revolutionary. My coworker recommended it to me and I LOVE it. First of all, I can’t believe it’s less than $100, let alone less than $40. That’s just downright amazing. I’ve been wanting a home security system for years but they’re always so expensive. A camera from Nest, for example, doesn’t have pan/tilt but costs well over $100. The app is also pretty amazing. I’m an iOS developer and I think their iOS app is truly top notch. All in all, this camera gets 10/5 stars from me!
customer_reviews.author: B. Hesse

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issues
customer_reviews.text: The first Wyze cam pan I ordered would not power on out of the box. I had it replaced and now I keep getting an error code 90 on the replacement cam. It's about 20 feet from my Meraki AP and signal strength is 36dB. Rebooting it temporarily fixes the issue but the camera goes offline again. I replaced an old Dropcam HD and was hoping to save money on the expensive monthly recording fees charged by Google Nest but I think I'm going to end up going back to Nest. The video quality is great for the price but it seems to get what you pay for in terms of overall hardware quality.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H.

customer_reviews.title: A quality camera at a very affordable price
customer_reviews.text: This camera does everything it advertises very well. It's extremely well made and small enough to install in very confined areas. It was pretty easy to set up and I have gone out of town and been able to monitor my home very quickly and easily. The two way sound feature is cool too. I can say hi to my pets while I'm at work. I am buying another camera so I can set one up at my summer home to monitor the yard when I'm gone.
customer_reviews.author: S. P. Banker

customer_reviews.title: Good for price but not high end. Has issues.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it’s fantastic. It does have problems though, sometimes when it’s really sunny out, it will find itself rebooting every couple of minutes. It has trouble transitioning from light to IR. In the transition times of dawn and dusk it can’t decide which it should use so it flip flops between the modes continuously for a good half hour, each time with a very loud CLICK. Picture quality is decent far away, but is abominable when you zoom in. No way to exclude certain things from triggering motion detection. Moving shadows outside like from the trees waving in the wind will trigger alerts. Microphone pickup isn’t sensitive enough. I’m keeping it though.
customer_reviews.author: EttanASF

customer_reviews.title: Could’ve been a five star
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera so I can watch my dog while I’m out I did the whole set up very easy my only problem is I get no notifications and it’s all set for all types of notifications it just will not notify me at all of a person or movement nothing I had another camera but it stopped working for me so I bought this one because of the good reviews I would’ve given a 5 star because the picture quality is great but can’t get the notifications to work so it’s 4 stars from me
customer_reviews.author: Mildred

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your camera buck.
customer_reviews.text: Good picture but not what I would expect for 1080 HD. No real zoom- just pinch to zoom. It “zooms” but you lose resolution. Motion tracking is well done. Follows the right things at the right time. App interface and setup is pretty straightforward like any IoT device these days. If you have an Amazon Fire device, you can ask Alexa to show you the live cam on the TV once the ‘skill’ is properly enabled. Will probably buy more. I’m interested in the stationary camera for another spot as well. ProTip: spend $10 and get the biggest microSD card it will take.
customer_reviews.author: Lester McGowan

customer_reviews.title: Great cameras for the price of the product. Wyze brand is great choice and low cost.
customer_reviews.text: I bumped into the Wyze products when they were brand new and not as known as they are today. Camera is great for your home, garage, yard, etc... Installed this as an outdoor camera with a waterproof bracket from a seller on Amazon and I've never had any issues with heat, cold, rain and snow... Great features available and for the pricing of them, there's no better deal than these Wyze cameras and has alot of Addons and more coming.
customer_reviews.author: Marco C.

customer_reviews.title: excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: After using this camera, I cant complain. Have the camera mounted on the corner and using it as motion detection. Motion detection is perfect only records a couple of seconds, then It will stop recording for 5mins and it will start recording again if motion is detected. Last month bought an SD micro memory card 128gb (Samsung) and so far keeps recording continuously. max it records is 15days on HD Quality and then starts deleting the old footage. Don't know if it will get above 128gb of memory.
customer_reviews.author: LOUIE

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect with one exception...
customer_reviews.text: The unit I got (not sure if it is just me) has terrible motion tracking. I need to set it to 100 to get any notifications at all even with people walking right in front of it. Hopefully this is just a firmware thing. My Wyzecam v2 has been flawless and picks up motion in the default setting perfectly (around 50). Please fix the motion tracking sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: MJP725

customer_reviews.title: Technically excellent, but poor documentation
customer_reviews.text: Discovered the Wyze cameras by accident, and their writeups seemed to be solid, do bought 2 to play with. I was surprised at their capabilities, but documentation was totally devoid of setup instructions. The app to control the cameras only gets you through connection to the app, nothing else. No explanations on feature sets, functionality, or connection to smart home networks. Their website is VERY Poor. So an IT professional like me, this was eventually solved, but a regular user would be confused and frustrated. The cameras technically were better than cams that are over 250.00 for Pan Tilt Zoom. The app allows for setup of Motion Detect, Motion Follow, but explanation on how is seriously missing.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Meyers

customer_reviews.title: All good
customer_reviews.text: Overall performance is great for the price. The IR is very dark and no adjustment can help it. We purchased a second pan/tilt had to return it bc it wouldn't scan to wifi code. I had the Blink and definitely preferred the Wyze. I wish they were fully waterproof and fully wireless. Update: we got a second Wyze Pan and Tilt after returning the one that would not scan the code, something was wrong with it. Well, the two Wyze cameras are really good for the price I only wish they would have one for Outdoors though they have covers to do so I am skeptical about it not being fully waterproof. This by far is a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Manie Mar

customer_reviews.title: your software sucks lately
customer_reviews.text: i have had wyze cam since day one i currently have 10 cameras in operation both old and new versions but i have bought 15 or so since inception so i have only 10 that work the other 5 when they update they just wont work anymore even repairing does not work countless time with tech support but being that there so cheap i keep buying new ones but this last update bricked 3 more and now with this person detection software they are pushing actually slows the camera software loading to a crawl so i keep buying new ones to replace bad software not hardware you guys at wyze have real software problems
customer_reviews.author: fireman

product_meta.title: Wyze Cam Pan 1080p Pan/Tilt/Zoom Wi-Fi Indoor Smart Home Camera with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Works with Alexa & the Google Assistant, White - WYZECP1
product_meta.description:
Style:Wyze Cam Pan

Say goodbye to losing sight when something moves outside the view of your camera. With its 110°/sec rotation speed, 360° horizontal range, and 93° vertical range, Wyze Cam Pan delivers 360° coverage in under 3 seconds so you can see exactly what you want to see, when you want to see it. 



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 




360° coverage Wyze Cam Pan gives you 360-degree coverage in under 3 seconds. Life moves fast. Your camera should too.

Works with Alexa Wyze Cam Pan works with Alexa. Control Wyze Cam Pan with your voice by saying, "Alexa, show me the Living Room" to view a live stream from your camera.




Clarity Day or Night With 6 infrared LEDs, Wyze Cam Pan’s enhanced night vision distinguishes 18 steps of gray and provides clear images up to 30 feet away.

Pan Scan Patrol your room with Pan Scan. Set the camera’s patrol route with up to 4 custom waypoints.

2-Way Audio Listen and talk to anyone you care about while not at home. Unique mic design minimizes motor sounds while providing high quality audio. A Class-K audio power amplifier enables high speaker volume.




MicroSD Card Storage Wyze Cam Pan supports local storage of recordings to a microSD card (sold separately). Play back videos with your Wyze app to solve life’s mysteries.




About the Startup Describe your product in 3 words.

Tech for all!

How did you come up with the idea for this product?

Wyze Labs was created with the mission of making high quality, easy-to-use, affordable smart home technology accessible to everyone. We believe big things come in small packages – that’s why we created an affordable, easy-to-use smart home camera that can help you solve life’s mysteries, big and small. So you can be everywhere. And watch everything.

What makes your product special?

In creating the Wyze Cam we focused on 3 things: quality, affordability and design. We partnered with our user community to create a camera that is useful, easy-to-use and affordable. It has the features users want, in an elegant, simple design.

What has been the best part of your startup experience?

Working directly with our user community to create a product we all love. We’re not just selling a camera – we’re creating a new way for our user community to participate in the product development journey, from vision to testing to launch. And this is just the beginning. We can’t wait for you to join us!
feature_bullets: Pan, tilt, and zoom (PTZ) lets you control Wyze Cam Pan remotely using the Wyze app so you can see every angle of your room while you’re away, on demand. Or, have Wyze Cam Pan monitor your room automatically with the Pan Scan feature by setting 4 predefined waypoints. Panning has a 360° left/right rotation range and tilting has a 93° vertical up/down range.
